channel.title: Help?
channel.description: ok im hosting a server but im not admin and i cant edit anything wtf.... im using testscape if anyone can help plz

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

well sry all he said was there was no staff file. dude i dont know whats wrong with it i have made an effort but sorry cant help you. sorry dude.

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

[quote=“guitars595, post:11, topic:218657”]Okay go into the Admin, Mod, and Member files and put your character name in the files, you should have control over the commands then. Save the files. Log off and Log back in. If that doesn’t make maybe try compiling it and then logging back in. If none of that works, you might have to get a different source.[/quote]he said there arent any, and .dat and .txt files dont have to be compiled, the server just has to be restarted for them, but not for files like admin or mod etc, but it should be as easy as logging out, changing rights to 3, then logging back in.

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

Okay go into the Admin, Mod, and Member files and put your character name in the files, you should have control over the commands then. Save the files. Log off and Log back in. If that doesn’t make maybe try compiling it and then logging back in. If none of that works, you might have to get a different source.

Read full topic

@guitars595 wrote:

Okay open your character name file again, make sure this character-ismember, is set to 1. Also go into the data file and tell me if there are files in there like Staff, Moderators, Members, Admin.

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @guitars595 guitars595
item.description:
@guitars595 wrote:

I can help you. Go into your source file and find the characters file. Make sure you have already created a character. Find your character name and open the file. At the top you should see Character rights=0. Change that to 4 or 5. Save that file and then log back in. You should be able to use most commands. In some sources ::Noclip does not work because the creator has disabled the use of it. Hopes that works though

Read full topic
